header.title: Modern Styling Strategies
header.description: Mastering Design Systems, Utility-First CSS, CSS-in-JS, and Responsive Design.

designSystem.title: Design Systems & Design Tokens
designSystem.description: The standardization of UI values (colors, spacing, typography) is the first step in scalable styling.

whatAreTokens.title: What are Design Tokens?
whatAreTokens.content: Design tokens are the atomic parts of a design system: colors, spacing, typography, radii, etc. They replace hard-coded values with meaningful names, ensuring consistency across the product.

whyUse.title: Why use them?
whyUse.consistencyDesc: Ensures the same 'blue' is used everywhere.
whyUse.maintainabilityDesc: Change one token value to update the entire app (e.g., Rebranding).
whyUse.communicationDesc: Common language between designers and developers.

cssModules.title: CSS Modules
cssModules.description: A CSS file in which all class names are scoped locally by default.

scopedStyles.title: Scoped Styles
scopedStyles.content: CSS Modules generate unique class names for each file, preventing global namespace collision. Files typically end with .module.css.

benefits.title: Benefits
benefits.localScopeDesc: No more worry about breaking other pages when changing a class (e.g., .container).
benefits.reuseDesc: Can compose styles from other files.

cssInJs.title: CSS-in-JS (Emotion / Styled-components)
cssInJs.description: Writing CSS styles directly within JavaScript files, enabling powerful dynamic styling.

emotionStyled.title: Emotion / Styled-components
emotionStyled.content: Leverage tagged template literals to write CSS. This allows using JavaScript variables and logic directly in styles.

consItems.runtimeDesc: Library must parse styles at runtime.
consItems.bundle: Larger bundle size compared to utility classes.
consItems.ssr: Setup needed for SSR (Next.js App Router limitation).

tailwind.title: Tailwind CSS
tailwind.description: A utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom user interfaces.

utilityFirst.title: Utility-First
utilityFirst.content: Instead of writing custom CSS, you use pre-existing classes directly in your HTML. This leads to very fast development cycles and consistent UI.

keyFeatures.title: Key Features
keyFeatures.jitDesc: Generates styles on demand, keeping bundle sizes tiny.
keyFeatures.standardizationDesc: spacing, colors, and sizes are pre-defined (or customized in config).

responsive.title: Responsive Design Strategy
responsive.description: Creating interfaces that adapt seamlessly to any screen size, from mobile phones to large desktops.

mobileFirst.title: Mobile-First Approach
mobileFirst.content: Design for the smallest screen first, then add complexity for larger screens. In Tailwind, this means unwrapped classes target mobile, and md:, lg: target larger screens.

toolsTechniques.title: Tools & Techniques
toolsTechniques.fluidTypographyDesc:
Use clamp() for smooth font scaling.
font-size: clamp(1rem, 2.5vw, 2rem);
toolsTechniques.artDirectionDesc: Use <picture> to serve different images for different screens to save bandwidth.

theme.title: Theme Systems
theme.description: Implementing Dark/Light modes and custom themes effectively.

cssVariables.title: CSS Variables Strategy
cssVariables.content: Define semantic color names mapped to CSS variables. Changing the class on <html> swaps the variable values.

tailwindDarkMode.title: Tailwind Dark Mode
tailwindDarkMode.content: Tailwind supports dark mode out-of-the-box with the dark: prefix. It can use system preference (`media`) or a class selector (`class`).

accessibility.title: Accessibility (A11y) & Styling
accessibility.description: ensure your styles do not exclude users. Valid HTML and thoughtful CSS are key.

checklist.title: Checklist
checklist.focusRingsDesc: Never set outline: none on focusable elements without replacing it. Is users navigate via keyboard, they must see where they are.
checklist.contrastDesc: Ensure text has sufficient contrast against the background (WCAG AA/AAA).
checklist.reducedMotionDesc: Respect user preference for standard motion.
checklist.colorAloneDesc: Use icons or text labels along with color to convey state (error, success).
